pullrequest.title: Fix case where a track is specified that exists in more than one genomedata

content.raw: If I understand this correctly, overlapping tracks are now caught if either (a) no tracks are specified OR (b) a track is specified that occurs multiple times. So a track can occur multiple times but if there is a command-line `--track` specification that does not include it, everything will be fine? I think that is OK, but we should probably have a comment describing how this edge case is not caught and also mention it in the documentation.
content.html: If I understand this correctly, overlapping tracks are now caught if either (a) no tracks are specified OR (b) a track is specified that occurs multiple times. So a track can occur multiple times but if there is a command-line --track specification that does not include it, everything will be fine? I think that is OK, but we should probably have a comment describing how this edge case is not caught and also mention it in the documentation.
